qas.question: Which President attempted to pack the supreme court?
Who had granted Franklin Roosevelt sweeping authority during the great depression?
Which presidents have tried to decrease the power of the presidential office?
Who claimed the president was not permitted to do whatever wasn't allowed by law?
Who failed to have considerable power during the Great Depression?
Who had considerable power during the Great Recession?
Who introduced a plan to decrease the number of Supreme Court seats for the president to fill?

context: Several <b2_0>twentieth-century presidents<b2_0/> have attempted to greatly expand the power of the presidency. <b3_0>Theodore Roosevelt<b3_0/>, for instance, claimed that the president was permitted to do whatever was not explicitly prohibited by the law—in direct contrast to his immediate successor, William Howard Taft. <b4_0><b5_0>Franklin Delano Roosevelt<b5_0/><b4_0/> held considerable power during the Great Depression. <a1_0>Congress<a1_0/> had granted <a0_0>Franklin Roosevelt<a0_0/> sweeping authority; in Panama Refining v. Ryan, the Court for the first time struck down a Congressional delegation of power as violative of the doctrine of separation of powers. The aforementioned Schechter Poultry Corp. v. United States, another separation of powers case, was also decided during Franklin Roosevelt's presidency. In response to many unfavorable Supreme Court decisions, <b6_0>Roosevelt<b6_0/> introduced a "Court Packing" plan, under which more seats would be added to the Supreme Court for the president to fill. Such a plan (which was defeated in Congress) would have seriously undermined the judiciary's independence and power.
